ygData.subject: RE: New Lullaby Results
ygData.msgSnippet: Bravo! Initially deceptive, had to read the intro 3 times before I figured it out...subtlety is an extraordinary literary talent. I m glad I don t have kids
ygData.messageBody:
Bravo!

Initially deceptive, had to read the intro 3 times before I figured it
out...subtlety is an extraordinary literary talent.

I'm glad I don't have kids yet, even though I'm sure I'd love them all the
same if it were not so.

-Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steven S. Klug [mailto:sklug@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 18, 2000 3:59 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] New Lullaby Results
>
>
> From: "Steven S. Klug" <sklug@...>
>
> I was getting ready to play EQ last night right
> after dinner and thought I would post the results
> of my Lullaby testing after the latest patch.
> Here's the scenario. I encountered a 2nd (nearly
> 3rd) level young human named Duncan in his lair.
> He is the common spawn in the "child's bedroom" of
> the Estate of Klug. Not wanting to ruin my Wife of
> Klug faction, I decided I'd use Lullaby to nod the
> mob, so that I could run away and continue
> adventuring. Now keep in mind that I'm 31st
> level, which is WELL beyond the level where I
> should have any problems with Lullaby functioning
> at peak efficiency. Well, my first attempt was
> resisted entirely...the mob continued to attack
> me, saying, "You will not escape me so easily,
> Daddy00! More stories!!!" My second attempt
> appeared to work, but just as I was running away
> (down the stairs) the mob woke up and began
> attacking me again, "Daddy00, I'm scared of the
> fire alarm!" Again, I fired up Lullaby. Again,
> the mob appeared to nod off, and I actually almost
> made it to the zone, when it woke up again. I ran
> back up the stairs to avoid aggroing anything
> else, and Lullabied again. Only this final one
> stuck. Now that's only one out of four attempts,
> for an overal resist rate of 75%! I think this is
> intolerable, and I may have to stop playing EQ if
> Verant doesn't fix this obvious nerf.
>
> Laluni Songhammer, 35th level bard of E'Ci.
>
> or
>
> Steven S. Klug, 31st level daddy of San Diego
> sklug@...
>
>
